meanings.definition: Excessively literary in style or content.
meanings.sent1: The overliterary writing in the book made it hard to understand.
meanings.sent2: Her overliterary prose was filled with complex metaphors and symbolism.
meanings.sent3: The overliterary description of the mundane task of washing dishes was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His overliterary language painted a vivid picture of the storm raging outside.
meanings.sent5: The overliterary nature of the poem left little room for the reader's imagination.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an excessive use of literary devices or techniques.
meanings.sent1: The overliterary use of similes and metaphors overwhelmed the reader.
meanings.sent2: The author's overliterary style included frequent allusions to classic literature.
meanings.sent3: The overliterary dialogue between the characters seemed out of place in a modern setting.
meanings.sent4: Her overliterary storytelling transported the audience to a magical realm.
meanings.sent5: The overliterary elements in the play added depth and richness to the narrative.
